definition: properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure
kjvTranslation: cure, (cause to) heal, physician, repair, [idiom] thoroughly, make whole. See H7503 (רָפָה).

translations.bg: правилно, да се поправи (чрез зашиване), т.е. (в преносен смисъл) да се излекува
translations.da: korrekt, at reparere (ved at sy), dvs. (i overført betydning) at helbrede
translations.el: σωστά, να επιδιορθώνω (με ράψιμο), δηλαδή (μεταφορικά) να θεραπεύω
translations.fr: proprement, raccommoder (par couture), c'est-à-dire (au sens figuré) guérir
translations.it: propriamente, riparare (ricucendo), cioè (in senso figurato) curare
translations.ja: つまり（比喩的に）治療する。
translations.lt: tinkamai, taisyti (susiuvant), t. y. (perkeltine prasme) gydyti
translations.lv: pareizi - salabot (ar šuvēm), t.i., (pārnestā nozīmē) izārstēt
translations.nb: riktig, å reparere (ved å sy), dvs. (i overført betydning) å kurere
translations.pl: właściwie, naprawiać (przez zszywanie), tj. (w przenośni) leczyć
translations.pt: propriamente dito, remendar (por costura), ou seja, (figurativamente) curar
translations.ro: corect, a repara (prin coasere), adică (la figurat) a vindeca
translations.sl: pravilno, popraviti (s šivanjem), tj. (v prenesenem pomenu) ozdraviti
translations.sv: korrekt, att laga (genom att sy), dvs. (bildligt) att bota
translations.tr: uygun şekilde, (dikiş atarak) onarmak, yani (mecazi olarak) iyileştirmek
translations.zh: 正确地说，是 "亡羊补牢"，即（比喻）治疗
